Villa Rica, GA Population by Race & Ethnicity

Racial distribution of Villa Rica population: 43.09% are white, 44.71% are Black or African American, 0.05% are American Indian and Alaska Native, 4.14% are Asian, 1.06% are some other race and 6.95% are multiracial.

By Neilsberg Research

Updated Jul 15, 2024

Villa Rica, GA population by race

The table below shows Villa Rica's population by race.

Race Population % of Total Population White 7,478 43.09% Black or African American 7,759 44.71% American Indian and Alaska Native 8 0.05% Asian 719 4.14% Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander 0 - Some other race 184 1.06% Two or more races (multiracial) 1,206 6.95%

TABLE OF CONTENTS

Villa Rica population by race

Of the 5 race categories (excluding ethnicity) identified by the Census Bureau, namely American Indian or Alaska Native, Asian, Black or African American, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander and White; Villa Rica has a population in all of the race categories.

This confirms that Villa Rica's population has become increasingly diverse.

The percent distribution of Villa Rica population by race (across all racial categories recognized by the U.S. Census Bureau): 43.09% are white, 44.71% are Black or African American, 0.05% are American Indian and Alaska Native, 4.14% are Asian, 1.06% are some other race and 6.95% are multiracial.

FIGURE 1

Villa Rica, GA population by race.

The largest racial group in Villa Rica is Black or African American with a population of 7,759 (44.71% of the total population).

Villa Rica 's racial breakdown clearly shows that there is no majority (i.e. more than 50% of the population belong to one particular race) of any race in the city.

As per the latest data estimates from American Community Survey's 5-year estimates:

1. The largest racial group in Villa Rica is Black or African American with a population of 7,759 (44.71% of the total population).

2. The multiracial population, i.e. population that identify themselves with two or more races , is 1,206 (6.95% of the total population).

Racial / Ethnic makeup of Villa Rica, GA

By ethnicity, 1,455 (8.38% of the total population) is Hispanic or Latino (of any race), and 15,899 (91.62% of the total population) is Non-Hispanic.

Of the Non-Hispanic population in Villa Rica, the largest racial group is Black or African American alone with a population of 7,650 (48.12% of the total Non-Hispanic population).

FIGURE 2

Villa Rica, GA Non-Hispanic population by race

All percentages shown below are, % of Villa Rica's Non-Hispanic population.

Villa Rica Non-Hispanic population by race

The distribution of the Non-Hispanic population across various race categories

Race Population % of Total Non-Hispanic Population White alone 6,853 43.10% Black or African American alone 7,650 48.12% American Indian and Alaska Native alone 8 0.05% Asian alone 719 4.52% Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone 0 0.00% Some other race alone 28 0.18% Two or more races (multiracial) 641 4.03%

Exploring Villa Rica's Diversity? Request Customized Data Now!

Among the Hispanic population in Villa Rica, regardless of the race, the largest group is of Mexican origin, with a population of 968 (66.53% of the total Hispanic population).

FIGURE 3

Villa Rica, GA Hispanic or Latino population

All percentages shown below are, % of Villa Rica's Hispanic population.

Villa Rica Hispanic or Latino population

The distribution of the Hispanic or Latino population by their ancestries

Origin Population % of Total Hispanic Population Mexican 968 66.53% Puerto Rican 113 7.77% Cuban 69 4.74% Other Hispanic or Latino 305 20.96%

References

U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey (ACS) 2018-2022 5-Year Estimates

Notes

The analysis presented in this article is based on estimates derived from the U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey. While these figures offer valuable insights, they are subject to a margin of error. It is advisable to exercise caution and consider the potential margin of error when interpreting and utilizing this data.

Datasets

Explore datasets by year of publication.

2024

Villa Rica, GA Population Breakdown By Race (Excluding Ethnicity) Dataset: Population Counts and Percentages for 7 Racial Categories as Identified by the US Census Bureau // 2024 Edition

Last updated July 7, 2024

About this dataset

Context

The dataset tabulates the population of Villa Rica by race. It includes the population of Villa Rica across racial categories (excluding ethnicity) as identified by the Census Bureau. The dataset can be utilized to understand the population distribution of Villa Rica across relevant racial categories.

Key observations

The percent distribution of Villa Rica population by race (across all racial categories recognized by the U.S. Census Bureau): 43.09% are white, 44.71% are Black or African American, 0.05% are American Indian and Alaska Native, 4.14% are Asian, 1.06% are some other race and 6.95% are multiracial.

Content

When available, the data consists of estimates from the U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey (ACS) 2018-2022 5-Year Estimates.

Racial categories include:

White

Black or African American

American Indian and Alaska Native

Asian

Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander

Some other race

Two or more races (multiracial)

Variables / Data Columns

Race: This column displays the racial categories (excluding ethnicity) for the Villa Rica

Population: The population of the racial category (excluding ethnicity) in the Villa Rica is shown in this column.

% of Total Population: This column displays the percentage distribution of each race as a proportion of Villa Rica total population. Please note that the sum of all percentages may not equal one due to rounding of values.

Good to know

Margin of Error

Data in the dataset are based on the estimates and are subject to sampling variability and thus a margin of error. Neilsberg Research recommends using caution when presening these estimates in your research.

Custom data

If you do need custom data for any of your research project, report or presentation, you can contact our research staff at research@neilsberg.com for a feasibility of a custom tabulation on a fee-for-service basis.

Inspiration

Neilsberg Research Team curates, analyze and publishes demographics and economic data from a variety of public and proprietary sources, each of which often includes multiple surveys and programs. The large majority of Neilsberg Research aggregated datasets and insights is made available for free download at https://www.neilsberg.com/research/.

Villa Rica, GA Hispanic or Latino Population Distribution by Ancestries Dataset : Detailed Breakdown of Hispanic or Latino Origins // 2024 Edition

Last updated July 7, 2024

About this dataset

Context

The dataset tabulates the Villa Rica Hispanic or Latino population. It includes the distribution of the Hispanic or Latino population, of Villa Rica, by their ancestries, as identified by the Census Bureau. The dataset can be utilized to understand the origin of the Hispanic or Latino population of Villa Rica.

Key observations

Among the Hispanic population in Villa Rica, regardless of the race, the largest group is of Mexican origin, with a population of 968 (66.53% of the total Hispanic population).

Content

When available, the data consists of estimates from the U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey (ACS) 2018-2022 5-Year Estimates.

Origin for Hispanic or Latino population include:

Mexican

Puerto Rican

Cuban

Other Hispanic or Latino

Variables / Data Columns

Origin: This column displays the origin for Hispanic or Latino population for the Villa Rica

Population: The population of the specific origin for Hispanic or Latino population in the Villa Rica is shown in this column.

% of Total Hispanic Population: This column displays the percentage distribution of each Hispanic origin as a proportion of Villa Rica total Hispanic or Latino population. Please note that the sum of all percentages may not equal one due to rounding of values.

Good to know

Margin of Error

Data in the dataset are based on the estimates and are subject to sampling variability and thus a margin of error. Neilsberg Research recommends using caution when presening these estimates in your research.
